availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Clough (Pettis, Missouri, teacher and notary public)

body.p: Pettis, Missouri, teacher and notary public. Massachusetts native. Married to Mary A. Clough. Father of William McNeill Clough. Teacher in St. Charles County, Missouri, in 1850. Notary Public in Platte County in 1860. Resident in Leavenworth, Kansas, in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Charles County, District 78, p. 53A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, Platte County, Pettis, p. 636.
Kansas State Census (1865), Population Schedules, Kansas, Leavenworth County, Leavenworth, Ward 1, p. 32-3.
"William Eben Clough (1787-1866)," Find A Grave, Memorial 39826933, accessed October 3, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/39826933.
